algorithm_technique: Base-26 conversion using modulo and division, handling zero-based indexing
problem_summary_simple: Convert a column number (like 1, 28) to its Excel column title string (like 'A', 'AB').
problem_summary_technical: Performs a modified base-26 conversion. Subtracts 1 from the number before modulo to handle 'Z' correctly, then converts remainders to characters.
key_insights: This is the inverse operation of 'excel-sheet-column-number'.
The key is to use (n-1) % 26 and (n-1) // 26 to correctly map numbers to characters, especially for 'Z' (which corresponds to 26).
The resulting characters are generated in reverse order and need to be reversed at the end.
